Abstract: Floyd Norris column offers review of stock market of last 100 years; says American public fell in and out of love with stock market at least twice during that time, before ending century completely enraptured with possibility of wealth via Wall Street; graphs and charts (M)
Snippet: Floyd Norris column offers review of stock market of last 100 years; says American public fell in and out of love with stock market at least twice during that time, before ending century completely enraptured with possibility of wealth via Wall St...
LeadParagraph: AS the 20th century began, high-yielding railroad shares were virtually the only blue-chip American stocks that a conservative investor would consider. As it ended, the most popular stocks were being issued by young companies that had never earned a dollar, let alone paid a dividend.

Headline.Main: Toward Dow 3,000,000 and Other Millennial Ruminations
Headline.PrintHeadline: THE MARKETS: STOCKS; Toward Dow 3,000,000 and Other Millennial Ruminations
